text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that the existence of a New York court injunction may work against the recognition of the Paris award based on a violation of public policy. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under Section III, stating: 'The opponent will contend that the tribunal's decision to proceed in defiance of a US court injunction constitutes a violation of due process and US public policy under Article V(2)(b).' It then dedicates the entire section to defending against this specific public policy/due process objection arising from the injunction.", "criterion_id": "f101b285-a1a0-4537-859b-11fe9252516e"}
